    • Method Detail

      • insertVertex

        Vertex insertVertex(java.lang.String n)
        A graph API. Appropriate implementation should provide many of the basic requirements of a graph ADT.

      • removeVertex

        java.lang.String removeVertex(Vertex v)
        Remove the given vertex from the graph. The name of the vertex is returned, or null if the graph does not contain the vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - Vertex
        Returns:
        the name of the vertex or null.

      • insertEdge

        Edge insertEdge(Vertex v,
                Vertex w,
                java.lang.String n)
        Build a new edge with end vertices v and w and name n and insert into the graph. Return the new Edge object. NB: The vertices u and v must already be in the graph.
        Parameters:
        v - Vertex
        w - Vertex
        n - String
        Returns:
        the new Edge

      • removeEdge

        java.lang.String removeEdge(Edge e)
        Remove the edge e from the graph. The name of the edge is returned (or null if the edge is not in the graph).
        Parameters:
        e - the edge to be removed
        Returns:
        the name or null if e does not exist

      • opposite

        Vertex opposite(Edge e,
                Vertex v)
        Return the endpoint vertex of edge e that is 'opposite' its other endpoint vertex v. Return null if e does not exist or does not have endpoint v
        Parameters:
        e - Edge
        v - Vertex
        Returns:
        a vertex or null

      • vertices

        java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> vertices()
        Return a collection containing of all of the vertices in the graph.
        Returns:
        a list of vertices

      • edges

        java.util.ArrayList<Edge> edges()
        Return a collection of all of the edges in the graph.
        Returns:
        a list of edges

      • areAdjacent

        boolean areAdjacent(Vertex v,
                    Vertex w)
        Checks whether two vertices are adjacent (i.e. joined by a single edge) or not.
        Parameters:
        v - a vertex
        w - a vertex
        Returns:
        true if v and we are adjacent and false otherwise.

      • incidentEdges

        java.util.ArrayList<Edge> incidentEdges(Vertex v)
        Finds and returns the set of edges that are incident to a given vertex.
        Parameters:
        v - the vertex
        Returns:
        a list of edges

      • rename

        java.lang.String rename(Vertex v,
                        java.lang.String n)
        Rename vertex v as n; returns the old vertex name
        Parameters:
        v - a vertex
        n - the new name
        Returns:
        the old edge name

      • rename

        java.lang.String rename(Edge e,
                        java.lang.String n)
        Rename edge e as n; returns the old edge name
        Parameters:
        e - an edge
        n - the new name
        Returns:
